page.title: 06PADDOCKHURST ESTATE I
page.content: {Paddockhurst}was once the home of {Robert Whitehead,}inventor of the {torpedo.}He sold the estate to the{1st {Viscount Cowdray}in{1898.}This private estate is now owned by a family trust, consists of{6,000 acres}and is to be found on the south west of{Turners {Hill.}It is self supporting with eight farms and one hundred and fifty houses, providing work in the large areas of the forest for fourteen men. The trees are varied; chestnut, oak, beech, spruce and yew. The timber is sold standing.{Coppicing}of the chestnut is a source of wood for palings made in the{saw mill}belonging to the estate. Softwoods are used for the maintenance of gates, fences, tree stakes etc. also made in the saw mill. An old{forge}is used now for the servicing of all the estate vehicles.
